info.document:
1 Victory for Samford against an SEC opponent: The Bulldogs beat Ole Miss 7-6 on Oct. 20, 1934. Samford has a 1-34-1 record against SEC opponents. The Bulldogs tied Alabama 7-7 on Sept. 28, 1935. Since that game, Samford has lost 30 consecutive games against SEC opponents.

1 Previous game has been played between Georgia and Samford. Georgia defeated Samford 39-0 on Oct. 29, 1943, in Athens.

1 Georgia player has more career rushing yards than RB Nick Chubb, who enters Saturday's game with 3,583. Georgia's Herschel Walker is the SEC's career rushing leader with 5,259 yards. Chubb ranks 15 in SEC history.

2 TD passes have been caught by WR Kelvin McKnight in each of Samford's games this season - a 28-23 victory over Kennesaw State on Aug. 31 and a 49-41 victory over West Alabama on Sept. 7.

5 Of Georgia's 10 wins since Kirby Smart became the Bulldogs' coach last season have featured fourth-quarter comebacks, including last week's 20-19 victory over Notre Dame. Georgia trailed the Fighting Irish 19-17 until Rodrigo Blankenship kicked a 30-yard field goal with 3:34 to play. Last season, the Bulldogs beat North Carolina, Missouri, Kentucky and TCU after trailing in the fourth quarter. Georgia also beat Auburn in a game that was tied in the fourth quarter. Georgia lost games in 2016 to Tennessee, Vanderbilt and Georgia Tech after the Bulldogs led in the fourth quarter.

16 Years since Georgia coach Kirby Smart was the defensive coordinator for Samford coach Chris Hatcher at Valdosta State.

181 Consecutive games without being shut out for Samford. Samford's most recent shutout loss came 29-0 to Tennessee Tech on Nov. 9, 2000.

277 Consecutive games without being shut out for Georgia, a school record and the third-longest streak in SEC history. Georgia's most recent shutout loss came 31-0 to Alabama on Sept. 30, 1995.
